column4: well I would like to connect to a leopard imac using ubuntu 7.10
and samba
the problem is, the mac can connect to me, but not vice versa
okay, so your server is set up properly, that's good
is the mac running a samba server?
might want to ask on #macosx, I don't really know how
yes, it's running on a samba server
any particular error message when you try to connect?
I have a problem with the mac network showing up in "Network", no error messages though.
Is there a way to manually connect to the mac network?
you can try connecting with smbclient, if you know the mac's ip address
And how exactly would I do that?
can you tell me how to use that smbclient?
looking up the man page as I no longer ever touch samba
okay, smbclient //SERVER/share
where SERVER is the mac's NETBios name and share is the shared dir
btw, can you access any other systems via samba through your Ubuntu box?
but do I type that in terminal?
yes
and the linux server can be thought of as another system... if THAT doesn't appear locally something's really up
it could be the ip address, and I think that IP address will invariably work. Whatever is the case, if the systems aren't on the same subnet... well that's ruled out
